alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 19 at 3:09AM MST until February 21 at 8:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of between 5 and 11 inches at lower elevation, with 12 to 22 inches possible in the mountains and over Marias Pass. Wind chills may fall as low as 15 to 35 degrees below zero on Sunday and Monday. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. Dangerous wind chills may cause frostbite in less than 30 minutes on Sunday and Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong wind gusts during the day on Saturday could lead to significant blowing and drifting of the falling and or fallen snow along and west of the United States Highway 89 corridor, especially west of Browning along United States Hwy 2.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
